page.title: 02Hills N E of Thornton Dale
page.content: An area of Low Hills rising from glacial plain (once Lake Pickering) Farmland mainly on lower 2/3 grassland to support sheep, store cattle and milking herds. Some arable fields and cereals. The upper 1/3 afforested by forestry commission (Dalby Forest) dated from 1921. Mainly coniferous forest. The older crops now being felled at rotation age of around 50 to 60 years. Replanted again with conifers and 10% broadleaved trees.The very picturesque village of Thornton Dale lies in SW corner of block. Very popular with visitors. Walkers and horse riders use footpaths and bridle paths.
